subject: Coaches and Managers
College Athletics
lead_paragraph: Kay Yow, the former North Carolina State women’s coach, was buried in her hometown, Gibsonville, N.C., about 70 miles west of Raleigh. Yow, a Hall of Famer, died Jan. 24 after a long fight with cancer. She coached at nearby Elon University for four years before taking over at North Carolina State in 1975 and piling up more than 700 career wins. The Wolfpack players and coaching staff were among about 300 mourners. After the graveside service, the team boarded a bus for Sunday’s game at Virginia Tech.
